title: setuptools build_ext always tries to load Cython
body:
`spack install py-matplotlib` with
- mpl 2.0.2
- python 2.7.13
- GCC 6.3.0

(- cython 0.25.2)

fails on a Cython error in Debian 9.2 (note that cython is not a direct dependency of MPL).

### Expected Result

It should build & install :)

### Actual Result

```

error: Cython does not appear to be installed
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install py-matplotlib
```

### Information on your system

- Debian 9.2 (x86_64)
- spack `develop` as of 80048ae4a

### Misc

Could this be related to the way python was build as in https://stackoverflow.com/a/2584554/2719194 ? Python seems to be indeed installed with `+pic+shared~tk~ucs4` when I check.

Running
```console
$ spack install py-matplotlib ^python+ucs4
```
then fails on
```
Cython/Compiler/Code.so: undefined symbol: PyFPE_jbuf
```
